Sense.DEF: the 17th letter of the English alphabet
Sense.TRAN: 英语字母表的第十七个字母
the written abbreviation of 书面缩写= question 问题
Sense.EXAMPLE: a Q and A session a time when people can ask questions and get answers
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 问答时间

Sense.TRAN: the written abbreviation of 书面缩写= quarterback〔美式橄榄球中组织进攻的〕四分卫﹐枢纽前卫

Sense.DEF: a barrister of high rank in the British legal system
the abbreviation of the Latin phrase quod erat demonstrandum, used to say that a fact or event proves that what you say is true
Sense.TRAN: 证毕﹐证讫〔拉丁文quod erat demonstrandum的缩写〕
the written abbreviation of 书面缩写= quart or 或 quarts 夸脱〔液量单位〕

Sense.DEF: secretly
a short stick with cotton at each end, used especially for cleaning your ears

Sense.TRAN: the written abbreviation of 书面缩写= quarter 四分之一﹔季度

Sense.DEF: used to show you are talking about the basic nature or job of someone or something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Money, qua money, cannot provide happiness.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 钱本身不能给人带来快乐。

Sense.DEF: to make the sound that ducks make
Sense.TRAN: 作鸭叫声﹐发出〔鸭子般的〕嘎嘎声

Sense.DEF: the sound a duck makes
someone who pretends to be a doctor – used in order to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 冒牌医生﹐江湖医生〔含贬义〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: quacks selling weight-loss drugs
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 兜售减肥药的江湖医生

Sense.DEF: a doctor
Sense.EXAMPLE: You’d better go and see the quack with that burn.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你最好去找医生看看那处烧伤。

Sense.DEF: relating to the activities or medicines of someone who pretends to be a doctor
Sense.EXAMPLE: a quack remedy
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 江湖医生的疗法

Sense.DEF: the activities of someone who pretends to be a doctor
a square open area with buildings all around it, especially in a school or college
Sense.TRAN: 〔周围有建筑物的〕方形中庭﹐四方院子〔尤见于学校〕

Sense.DEF: a quadruplet
a small vehicle, similar to a motorcycle but with four wide wheels, usually ridden on rough paths or fields
Sense.TRAN: 四轮摩托车〔常在崎岖不平的路面或田地上行驶〕

Sense.DEF: another form of quadri-
a square open area with buildings all around it, especially at a school or college
Sense.TRAN: 〔周围有建筑物的〕方形中庭﹐四方院子〔尤见于学校〕

Sense.DEF: a flat shape that has four straight sides
a quarter of a circle
Sense.TRAN: 四分之一圆(周)﹔九十度弧

Sense.DEF: an instrument for measuring angles, used when sailing or looking at the stars

using a system of sound recording, broadcasting etc in which sound comes from four different
speaker s at the same time
an equation such as ax2+by+c=z, which includes numbers or quantities multiplied by themselves
four or four times
Sense.EXAMPLE: a quadrilateral shape with four straight sides
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 四边形
Sense.EXAMPLE: a quadruped animal with four legs
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 四足动物

Sense.DEF: the large muscle at the front of your thigh
a flat shape with four straight sides
a dance, popular especially in the 19th century, in which the dancers form a square
Sense.TRAN: 方阵舞﹐夸德里尔舞〔19世纪盛行的一种舞蹈〕

Sense.DEF: the number one followed by 15 zeros
the number one followed by 24 zeros
someone who is permanently unable to move any part of their body below their neck
Sense.TRAN: 四肢麻痹的人﹐四肢瘫痪的人
Sense.EXAMPLE: A car accident left him a quadriplegic.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一场车祸让他四肢瘫痪了。

Sense.DEF: another spelling of quadraphonic
another form of quadri-
an animal that has four legs
to increase and become four times as big or as high, or to make something increase in this way
Sense.EXAMPLE: Food prices quadrupled during the war.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 战争期间食品价格翻了两番。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The company has quadrupled its profits in just three years.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 公司利润在短短三年里增长至原来的四倍。

Sense.DEF: four times as big or as many
Sense.EXAMPLE: The subjects were given quadruple the normal dosage of the drug.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 让实验对象服用了四倍于正常剂量的药物。

Sense.DEF: involving four things of the same kind
Sense.EXAMPLE: a quadruple murder
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 四人遇害的凶杀案

Sense.DEF: one of four babies born at the same time to the same mother
to drink a lot of something quickly
Sense.EXAMPLE: Wedding guests quaffed champagne.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 婚礼上宾客开怀畅饮香槟酒。

Sense.DEF: an area of soft wet muddy ground
Sense.EXAMPLE: In the rainy season the roads become a quagmire.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在雨季﹐道路变得一片泥泞。

Sense.DEF: a difficult or complicated situation
Sense.EXAMPLE: The Balkan situation became a political and military quagmire.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 巴尔干半岛局势成了政治和军事上的一大难题。

Sense.DEF: a small fat bird with a short tail that is hunted for food or sport, or the meat from this bird
to be afraid and show it by shaking a little bit or moving back slightly

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She quailed visibly at the sight of the prison walls.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 看到监狱的围墙﹐她显然胆怯了。

Sense.DEF: unusual and attractive, especially in an old-fashioned way
Sense.TRAN: 奇特的﹐别致的﹔〔尤指〕古色古香的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a quaint little village in Yorkshire
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 约克郡一个古色古香的小村庄

Sense.DEF: to shake or tremble, usually because you are very frightened
Sense.EXAMPLE: Richmond was quaking with fury.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 里士满气得发抖。

Sense.DEF: to feel very afraid – used humorously
if the earth, a building etc quakes, it shakes violently
Sense.TRAN: 〔大地﹑建筑物等〕剧烈颤动﹐震动
Sense.EXAMPLE: The explosion made the whole house quake.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 爆炸使整个房子都晃动起来。

Sense.DEF: an earthquake
a member of the Society of Friends, a Christian religious group that meets without any formal ceremony or priests and that is opposed to violence
Sense.TRAN: 〔基督教〕贵格会教徒﹐公谊会教徒﹐教友会教徒

Sense.DEF: if you have a qualification, you have passed an examination or course to show you have a particular level of skill or knowledge in a subject
Sense.TRAN: 〔通过考试或学习课程取得的〕资格﹔学历
Sense.EXAMPLE: He left school without any qualifications.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他离校时没有拿到任何文凭。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We are looking for graduates with qualifications in maths or science.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们需要具备数学或理科学历的毕业生。

Sense.DEF: a skill, personal quality, or type of experience that makes you suitable for a particular job or position
Sense.TRAN: 〔胜任某一工作或职位所需的〕技能条件﹐资格﹔资历

GramExa.EXAMPLE: health and fitness qualifications for membership in the Territorial Army
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 加入本土防卫义勇军所需要的健康条件

GramExa.EXAMPLE: There have been questions about his qualifications to lead the company.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他领导公司的能力受到了质疑。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Does he have the right qualifications to become a Supreme Court Justice?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他具备担任最高法院大法官所需的条件吗？

Sense.DEF: when a person or team reaches a necessary standard, for example by passing an examination or defeating another team
Sense.TRAN: 取得资格﹐合格﹐达到标准
Sense.EXAMPLE: Upon qualification, you can expect to find work abroad fairly easily.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 取得资格之后﹐你在国外找工作就会比较容易。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the US qualification for the World Cup
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 美国的世界杯参赛资格

Sense.DEF: something that you add to a statement to limit its effect or meaning
Sense.EXAMPLE: I welcome without qualification the Minister’s proposal.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我无条件赞同部长的提议。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: You don’t need to have any qualifications for this job.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 这份工作不需要任何学历。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: 40 percent of the prisoners lack any qualifications.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 40%的犯人没有任何学历。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: I want to get the qualifications so that I can become a doctor.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我想取得文凭﹐那样就能当医生了。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Eva had excellent academic qualifications.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 伊娃拥有相当出色的学历。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Too many children leave school without any educational qualifications.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 太多的孩子离校时没有拿到文凭。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: She has a degree and a teaching qualification.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 她拥有学位和教师资格。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: one relating to a professional job, such as a teacher, lawyer etc
one relating to a skilled job, such as nurse or a builder
official qualifications rather than experience
documents showing that you have passed exams, rather than actual experience of doing something

Sense.DEF: having suitable knowledge, experience, or skills, especially for a particular job
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指做某项工作〕有资格的﹐合格的﹐胜任的

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Dawn is well qualified for her new role.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 唐十分胜任她的新角色。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The guides are qualified to lead groups into the mountains.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些导游有资格带团进山。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: If you don’t speak German, you’re not qualified to comment.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果你不会说德语﹐你就没有资格评论。

Sense.DEF: having passed a professional examination

GramExa.EXAMPLE: There are qualified instructors on hand to advise you.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 随时都有合格的教练来指导你。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a fully qualified nurse
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一名完全合格的护士

Sense.EXAMPLE: a professionally qualified social worker
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有专业资格的社会工作者
Sense.EXAMPLE: Are you medically qualified?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你有行医资格吗？

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He’s qualified to teach biology at high school level.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他有资格教高中生物。

Sense.DEF: limited in some way
Sense.TRAN: 有限度的﹔有保留的﹔有条件的

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The proposal received qualified approval.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个提议只得到有保留的赞同。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The program was considered a qualified success.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个节目被认为只取得了一定程度的成功。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Is it worth the money? The answer is a qualified yes.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 它值这么多钱吗？答案是未必。

Sense.DEF: someone who has reached the necessary standard for entering a competition, especially by defeating other competitors
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指击败对手〕取得参赛资格的人﹔合格者
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s among the qualifiers for the Lancome Trophy at Paris.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他是巴黎兰蔻杯赛的入围者之一。

Sense.DEF: a game that you have to win in order to be able to take part in a competition
Sense.EXAMPLE: the World Cup qualifier against the Netherlands
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对阵荷兰的世界杯预选赛

Sense.DEF: a word or phrase that limits or adds to the meaning of another word or phrase
to have the right to have or do something, or to give someone this right
Sense.EXAMPLE: Free school lunches are given to children who qualify.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 符合条件的儿童可获得免费的学生午餐。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: You may qualify for unemployment benefit.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你也许有资格领取失业救济金。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Membership qualifies you for a discount on purchases.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 会员购买可以享受优惠。

Sense.DEF: to pass an examination or finish a course of study that you need in order to do something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I finally qualified as a pilot.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我终于取得了飞行员资格。

Sense.EXAMPLE: After qualifying, doctors spend at least two years working in hospitals.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 医生在取得资格后至少还要在医院工作两年。

Sense.DEF: to have all the necessary qualities to be considered to be a particular thing

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It doesn’t qualify as a date if you bring your children with you.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果你带孩子一起来﹐那还算什么约会。

Sense.DEF: if something qualifies you to do something, you have the necessary skills, knowledge, ability etc to do it

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Fluency in three languages qualifies her for work in the European Parliament.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她能流利地说三种语言﹐这使她有资格在欧洲议会工作。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The certificate qualifies you to work as a dental assistant.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这份证书能使你有资格当牙医助手。

Sense.DEF: to reach the necessary standard to enter or continue in a competition or sports event

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She qualified for a spot on the U.S. Olympic speed skating team.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她入选美国奥运速度滑冰队。

Sense.DEF: to add to something that has already been said, in order to limit its effect or meaning
Sense.TRAN: 修正﹐限定〔刚刚说过的话〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Could I just qualify that last statement?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我能具体说明一下最后那句话吗？

Sense.DEF: if a word or phrase qualifies another word or phrase, it limits or adds to the meaning of it
relating to the quality or standard of something rather than the quantity

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a qualitative study of educational services
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 对教育服务的定性研究

RunOn.EXAMPLE: Women’s experiences are qualitatively different from men’s.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 女性的经历与男性的经历有实质上的差别。

Sense.DEF: how good or bad something is
Sense.EXAMPLE: Much of the land was of poor quality.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 很多地的土质很差。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Use only high quality ingredients.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 只使用上等的材料。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The quality of the water is reasonably good.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 水质还算不错。

Sense.DEF: something that people may have as part of their character, for example courage or intelligence
Sense.EXAMPLE: He shows strong leadership qualities.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他表现出很好的领导素质。
Sense.EXAMPLE: the personal qualities necessary to be a successful salesman
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 成为成功的销售员所必需的个人素质

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the qualities of honesty and independence
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 诚实﹑独立的品性

Sense.DEF: something that is typical of one thing and makes it different from other things, for example size, colour etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: the drug’s addictive quality
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 毒品令人上瘾的特性

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the physical and chemical qualities of the rock
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 岩石的物理特性和化学特性

Sense.DEF: a high standard
Sense.EXAMPLE: his pride in the quality of his craftsmanship
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他为自己的好手艺而自豪
Sense.EXAMPLE: wines of quality
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 优质葡萄酒

Sense.DEF: how good or bad your life is, shown for example by whether or not you are happy, healthy, able to do what you want etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: drugs that improve the quality of life for very ill patients
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 能改善重病患者生活质量的药物

Collocate.EXAMPLE: I was impressed that the quality of their work was so high.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们的工作质量很高﹐给我留下了深刻的印象。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The magazine is printed on low quality paper.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 这本杂志的印刷纸张质量很差。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The T-shirts are only $10 and the quality is excellent.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些T恤才十块钱﹐而且质量非常好。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: good or better quality
Collocate.EXAMPLE: These speakers offer superior quality sound.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些扬声器音质优异。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Our chef uses only top quality ingredients.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们的厨师只用顶级食材。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Scientists took samples to test the water quality.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 科学家取样化验水质。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The measures will improve the quality of the water in the river.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些措施将会改善河水水质。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Lack of sleep started to affect the quality of his work.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 睡眠不足开始影响他的工作质量。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The equipment is used to monitor the city’s air quality.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 这台设备用于监测城市的空气质量。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: it is badly affected by something

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Greater investment is needed to meet the European Union’s strict quality standards.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 为了达到欧盟严格的质量标准﹐需要更多投资。

ErrorBox.HINTTRAN: Do not say 不要说 ‘living quality’ or 或 ‘life quality’. Say 而要说 quality of life.

Sense.DEF: very good – used especially by people who are trying to sell something
Sense.TRAN: 优质的﹐非常好的〔尤用作推销语〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: quality childcare at prices people can afford
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 人们负担得起的优质儿童护育服务
Sense.EXAMPLE: quality double glazing
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 优质的双层玻璃

Sense.DEF: newspapers etc intended for educated readers
Sense.TRAN: 高质量的[内容严肃的]报纸/报刊等

Sense.DEF: the practice of checking the quality of goods or services that a company sells, so that the standard continues to be good
the practice of checking goods as they are produced to be sure that their quality is good enough
the time that you spend giving someone your full attention, especially time that you spend with your children when you are not busy
Sense.TRAN: 珍贵时光﹐优质时间〔尤指全心照顾子女的时间〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Do you spend enough quality time with your children?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你与孩子相处的时间够多吗？

Sense.DEF: a feeling of slight worry or doubt because you are not sure that what you are doing is right
Sense.EXAMPLE: Despite my qualms, I took the job.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 尽管有些疑虑﹐我还是接受了那份工作。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The manager has no qualms about dropping players who do not perform well.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对于放弃那些表现不好的队员﹐主教练并无不安。

Sense.DEF: a difficult situation or problem, especially one in which you cannot decide what to do

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Kate was in a quandary over whether to go or not.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 走还是不走﹐凯特左右为难。

Sense.DEF: an independent organization in Britain, started by the government but with its own legal powers
Sense.TRAN: 〔英国的〕准自治管理机构﹔半官方机构

Sense.DEF: the plural of quantum
a word or phrase such as ‘much’, ‘few’, or ‘a lot of’ that is used with a noun to show quantity
to calculate the value of something and express it as a number or an amount
Sense.TRAN: 测定…的数量﹔用数量表示﹐量化
Sense.EXAMPLE: an attempt to quantify the region’s social and economic decline
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对该地区社会和经济衰退进行量化的尝试

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The damage caused to the tourist industry is difficult to quantify.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 对旅游业所造成的损失难以量化。

RunOn.EXAMPLE: The cost of unemployment to the government is quite easily quantifiable.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 失业对政府造成的损失很容易量化。

Sense.DEF: relating to amounts rather than to the quality or standard of something
Sense.TRAN: (数)量的﹔与数量有关的﹔定量的

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We need to do a proper quantitative analysis of this problem.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们需要对这个问题作一个正确的定量分析。

Sense.DEF: an amount of something that can be counted or measured

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The police also found a quantity of ammunition in the flat.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 警方还在公寓里发现了一些弹药。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Add 50 grams of butter, and the same quantity of sugar.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 加入50克黄油和等量的糖。

GramExa.PROPFORM: a large/small/vast etc quantity of sth
GramExa.EXAMPLE: He had consumed a large quantity of alcohol.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他喝了很多酒。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Huge quantities of oil were spilling into the sea.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 大量石油正溢入大海。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Buy vegetables in small quantities, for your immediate use.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 蔬菜不要多买﹐现买现用。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Your work has improved in quantity and quality this term.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这学期你的作业在完成数量和质量上都有提高。
Sense.HINTTRAN: Do not say 不要说 ‘a big quantity’. Say 而要说 a large quantity.

Sense.DEF: the large amount of something
Sense.EXAMPLE: The sheer quantity of text meant that people did not read the whole of their newspaper.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 巨大的篇幅意味着人们读不完报纸的全部内容。

Sense.DEF: in large amounts
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s a lot cheaper if you buy it in quantity.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大批量购买要便宜得多。

Sense.DEF: someone whose job is to calculate the amount of materials needed to build something, how long it will take to build, and how much it will cost
a unit of energy in nuclear physics
a very advanced and powerful type of computer that is being developed, which uses the principles of quantum mechanics
a very large and important development or improvement
Sense.TRAN: 长足进展﹐飞跃﹐突飞猛进

GramExa.EXAMPLE: There has been a quantum leap in the range of the wines sold in the UK.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 英国销售的葡萄酒品种数大大增加了。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The treatment of breast cancer has taken a quantum leap forward.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 乳腺癌的治疗有了重大突破。

Sense.DEF: the scientific study of the way that atoms and smaller parts of things behave
the idea that energy, especially light, travels in separate pieces and not in a continuous form
a period of time when a person or animal is kept apart from others in case they are carrying a disease

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The monkeys were kept in quarantine for 31 days.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些猴子被隔离了31天。

Sense.DEF: to keep a person or animal apart from others for a period of time in case they are carrying a disease
Sense.TRAN: 对〔动物或人〕进行检疫隔离

Sense.DEF: a very small part of something, which is smaller than an atom
an angry argument or disagreement

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Jacob left after a quarrel with his wife.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 雅各布和妻子吵了一架后走了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: They had a quarrel about some girl.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们为某个女孩吵了一架。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Had there been any quarrel between you?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你们俩吵过架了吗？

Sense.DEF: a reason to disagree with something or argue with someone
Sense.TRAN: 不同意的原因﹔争执的缘由

GramExa.EXAMPLE: My only quarrel with this plan is that it’s going to take far too long.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我对这个计划唯一的意见是它太费时间了。

Sense.EXAMPLE: I have no quarrel with the court’s verdict.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我对法庭的裁决没有异议。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: We had a terrible quarrel last night.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们昨晚大吵了一架。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: deliberately start one
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Members of the gang were picking quarrels with strangers.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 团伙成员故意找陌生人争吵。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: end it
Collocate.EXAMPLE: The brothers eventually patched up their quarrel.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 兄弟俩终于结束了争吵。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: starts to happen
Collocate.EXAMPLE: A fresh quarrel broke out between the players.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 球员间爆发了新一轮争吵。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Your family quarrels are none of my concern.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 你的家庭纠纷不关我的事。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Outside, two teenagers were having a lovers’ quarrel.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 屋外﹐两个十几岁的情侣在斗嘴。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: involving strong feelings of anger or hatred
Collocate.EXAMPLE: They are locked in a bitter quarrel over ownership of the land.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们为争夺土地所有权而吵得不可开交。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: one that has existed for a long time

Sense.DEF: to have an argument
Sense.EXAMPLE: I wish you two would stop quarreling.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我希望你们两个别再吵了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I always seem to be quarrelling with my parents.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我好像总是在和父母吵架。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We’re not going to quarrel about a few dollars.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们不会为了几块钱争吵。

Sense.DEF: to disagree with something or complain about something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Nobody could quarrel with the report’s conclusions.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 报告的结论无可辩驳。

Sense.DEF: someone who is quarrelsome quarrels a lot with people
Sense.EXAMPLE: He became quarrelsome after drinking too much.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他喝多了就爱找人吵架。

Sense.DEF: a place where large amounts of stone or sand are dug out of the ground
Sense.EXAMPLE: a slate quarry
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 板岩采石场

Sense.DEF: the person or animal that you are hunting or chasing
Sense.EXAMPLE: Briefly, the hunter and his quarry glared at each other.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一时间﹐猎手和他的猎物四目相对。

Sense.DEF: to dig stone or sand from a quarry

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The rock here is quarried for building stones.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这儿的岩石被开采出来用作建筑石材。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Chalk is quarried from the surrounding area.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 白垩开采自周边地区。

Sense.DEF:
a clay tile that has not been
glaze d . Quarry tiles are used to cover floors.
a unit for measuring liquid, equal to two pints. In Britain this is 1.14 litres, and in the US it is 0.95 litres.
Sense.TRAN: 夸脱〔液量单位﹐合2品脱﹐在英国相当于1.14升﹐在美国相当于0.95升〕

Sense.DEF: one of four equal parts into which something can be divided

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a quarter of a mile
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 四分之一英里
GramExa.EXAMPLE: roughly one quarter of the city’s population
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个城市大约四分之一的人口

Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s about a page and a quarter.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大概是一又四分之一页。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: three quarters of a million pounds
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 75万英镑

GramExa.EXAMPLE: in the last quarter of the 19th century
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 在19世纪最后的25年里

Sense.EXAMPLE: Cut the cake into quarters.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 把蛋糕切成四等份。
Sense.HINTTRAN: Say 要说 a quarter of something, not 不要说 ‘quarter of’ something.

Sense.DEF: a period of 15 minutes
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ll meet you in a quarter of an hour.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们一刻钟之后见。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She arrived three quarters of an hour 45 minutes late.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她迟到了45分钟。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It’s a quarter of two.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 现在是差一刻两点。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I’ll meet you at a quarter past ten.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们十点一刻碰面。

Sense.DEF: a coin used in the US and Canada worth 25 cents
Sense.TRAN: 〔美国和加拿大的〕二十五分硬币

Sense.DEF: a period of three months, used especially when discussing business and financial matters

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The company’s profits rose by 11% in the first quarter of the year.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 今年第一季度公司利润增加了11%。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Our database is updated every quarter.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们的数据库每个季度都更新。

Sense.DEF: one of the four equal periods of time into which games of some sports are divided
Sense.TRAN: 〔某些分四节进行的体育比赛的〕一节﹐一局

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The home side took the lead in the second quarter.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 第二节主队领先。

Sense.DEF: an area of a town
Sense.EXAMPLE: I found a small flat in the student quarter.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我在学生居住区找到一间小公寓。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Granada’s ancient Arab quarter
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 格拉纳达古老的阿拉伯人居住区
Sense.EXAMPLE: a historic quarter of the city
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 古城区

Sense.DEF: the rooms that are given to someone to live in as part of their job, especially servants or soldiers
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指用人或军人的〕宿舍﹐住房﹔营房
Sense.EXAMPLE: The top floor provided living quarters for the kitchen staff.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 顶层是厨房员工的住处。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Most of the officers live in married quarters houses where soldiers live with their wives.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大多数军官居住在已婚军人宿舍里。

Sense.DEF: one of the four periods into which a year at school or college is divided, continuing for 10 to 12 weeks
Sense.TRAN: 学季〔四分之一学年﹐持续10至12周〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: What classes are you taking this quarter?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个学季你修哪些课？

Sense.DEF: the period of time twice a month when you can see a quarter of the moon’s surface
among or from different groups of people
Sense.EXAMPLE: Offers of financial help came from several quarters.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 多方人士提供了资金援助。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Doubts were expressed in many quarters.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 许多团体都表达了疑虑。

Sense.DEF: everywhere in the world
if someone gives no quarter, they do not show any pity or gentleness when dealing with someone, especially an enemy
Sense.TRAN: 不怜悯〔某人﹐尤指敌人〕/不被〔某人﹐尤指敌人〕怜悯
Sense.EXAMPLE: It was a fight to the death, with no quarter given.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那是一场殊死搏斗﹐谁也不会心慈手软。

Sense.DEF: to cut or divide something into four parts
Sense.TRAN: 把…切成四部分﹐把…四等分
Sense.EXAMPLE: Quarter the tomatoes and place them round the dish.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 把番茄都切成四瓣﹐摆放在盘子周边。

Sense.DEF: to provide someone with a place to sleep and eat, especially soldiers
Sense.TRAN: 为〔某人﹐尤指军人〕提供食宿
Sense.EXAMPLE: Our troops were quartered in Boston until June.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们的部队在波士顿一直驻扎到6月份。

Sense.DEF: the player in American football who directs the team’s attacking play and passes the ball to the other players at the start of each attack
Sense.TRAN: 〔美式橄榄球运动组织进攻的〕四分卫﹐枢纽前卫

Sense.DEF: someone who gives advice about something only after it has happened
Sense.TRAN: 放马后炮的人﹐事后诸葛亮

Sense.DEF: to play in the position of quarterback in American football
Sense.TRAN: 〔在美式橄榄球比赛中〕担任四分卫[枢纽前卫]

Sense.DEF: to organize or direct an activity, event etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: She quarterbacked the new sales campaign.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她组织了新的促销活动。

Sense.DEF: a day which officially begins a three-month period of the year, and on which payments are made, for example at the stock exchange
Sense.TRAN: 季度结算日〔季度的第一天﹐证券等的清账日〕

Sense.DEF: the back part of the upper level of a ship, which is used mainly by officers
Sense.TRAN: 〔主要供军官使用的〕上层后甲板区

Sense.DEF: one of the four games near the end of a competition, whose winners play in the two semi-finals
produced or happening four times a year
Sense.TRAN: 一年四次的[地]；每季度的[地]
Sense.EXAMPLE: We publish a quarterly journal.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们出版一份季刊。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The rent is payable quarterly.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 房租按季度支付。

Sense.DEF: a magazine that is produced four times a year
a military officer in charge of providing food, uniforms etc
a ship’s officer in charge of signals and guiding the ship on the right course
a musical note which continues for a quarter of the length of a whole note
an English law court that was held in the past once every three months
a long wooden pole that was used as a weapon in the past
four singers or musicians who sing or play together
Sense.TRAN: 四重唱组合﹔四重奏乐团
Sense.EXAMPLE: a string quartet four people playing musical instruments with strings, such as violins
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 弦乐四重奏组

Sense.DEF: a piece of music written for four performers
four people or things of the same type
Sense.TRAN: 四人组﹔四件套﹐四个一组

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a quartet of short films set in the 1920s
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 以20世纪20年代为背景的四部系列短片

Sense.DEF: the size of paper made by folding a normal large sheet of paper twice to produce four sheets
Sense.TRAN: 四开〔标准印张的四分之一〕

Sense.DEF: a hard mineral substance that is used in making electronic watches and clocks
Sense.EXAMPLE: quartz crystals
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 石英晶体
Sense.EXAMPLE: a quartz watch
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 石英表

Sense.DEF: an object in space that is similar to a star and that shines very brightly
to officially say that a legal judgment or decision is no longer acceptable or correct
Sense.TRAN: 宣布〔判决或决定〕不再有效﹔废除﹐撤销
Sense.EXAMPLE: The High Court later quashed his conviction for murder.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 高等法院后来撤销了他犯有谋杀罪的判决。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The decision was quashed by the House of Lords.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个决议被上议院推翻了。

Sense.DEF: to say or do something to stop something from continuing
Sense.EXAMPLE: A hospital chief executive has quashed rumours that people will lose their jobs.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 医院院长已澄清了员工将失业的谣言。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The government immediately moved to quash the revolt.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府立即采取行动平定叛乱。

Sense.DEF: like something else or trying to be something else
Sense.EXAMPLE: a quasi-scientific approach
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 半科学的办法
Sense.EXAMPLE: a quasi-governmental organization
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 半官方机构

Sense.DEF: the day or year exactly 400 years after a particular event

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the quatercentenary of Shakespeare’s birth
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 莎士比亚诞辰四百周年

Sense.DEF: a group of four lines in a poem
if your voice quavers, it shakes as you speak, especially because you are nervous or upset
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘It’s not true,’ she said, in a quavering voice.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “这不是真的。”她颤声说道。
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘No,’ he quavered.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “不。”他声音都颤抖了。

Sense.DEF: a musical note which continues for an eighth of the length of a semibreve
a shaking sound in your voice
a place in a town or village where boats can be tied up or can stop to load and unload goods
the area next to a quay
Sense.TRAN: 码头边﹐码头前沿地带﹐码头区
Sense.EXAMPLE: people strolling along the quayside
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 沿码头散步的人们
Sense.EXAMPLE: a quayside restaurant
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一家码头边的餐厅

Sense.DEF: feeling that you are going to vomit
Sense.EXAMPLE: The sea got rougher, and I began to feel queasy.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 海上风浪更猛了﹐我开始感到有点恶心想吐。

Sense.DEF: feeling uncomfortable because an action seems morally wrong
Sense.TRAN: 〔因某行为似乎不合道义〕感到不自在的﹐感到不安的

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Many Democrats felt queasy about the issue.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 很多民主党人士对这个问题感到很不安。

Subsense.DEF: the female ruler of a country

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Cleopatra, Queen of Egypt
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 埃及女王克里奥帕特拉

Subsense.EXAMPLE: At 18, Victoria was crowned queen officially became ruler.

Sense.DEF: a playing card with a picture of a queen on it
Sense.EXAMPLE: the queen of diamonds
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 方块Q﹐方块王后

Sense.DEF: the woman or place that is considered the best in a particular area or activity
Sense.TRAN: 〔某个领域的〕女王﹐最优秀的女子﹔最好的地方
Sense.EXAMPLE: With 42 albums, she was the queen of pop.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她推出了42张专辑﹐是流行乐天后。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Paris, the queen of fashion
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 巴黎——时尚之都

Sense.DEF: the woman who wins a beauty competition, or who is chosen to represent a school, area etc
Sense.TRAN: 选美王后﹔〔学校﹑地区等的〕女性形象代言人
Sense.EXAMPLE: the carnival queen
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 狂欢节王后

Sense.DEF: a large female bee, ant etc, which lays the eggs for a whole group
a woman who behaves as if she is the most important person in a place
Sense.TRAN: 派头十足的女性﹐大姐大

Sense.DEF: an offensive word for a male homosexual who behaves very like a woman. Do not use this word.
the most powerful piece in the game of chess
technical to change a pawn into a queen in the game of chess
if a woman queens it over other people, she behaves as if she is more important than them, in an annoying way
Sense.TRAN: 〔女性〕盛气凌人地对待某人﹐大摆架子

Sense.DEF: like a queen or suitable for a queen
Sense.EXAMPLE: She gave a queenly wave as she rode past.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她骑马经过时像女王一样挥了挥手。

Sense.DEF: the mother of the ruling king or queen
a qc
to speak very correctly and in a way that is typical of people who belong to the highest social class
if a criminal turns Queen’s evidence, they agree to help the police and law courts to catch other criminals by giving them information
Sense.TRAN: 供出对同案犯不利的证据﹐〔罪犯〕作为污点证人指控同党

Sense.DEF: a queen-size bed, sheet etc is a bed for two people that is larger than the standard size
Sense.TRAN: 〔床﹑床单等〕大号的﹐大于标准尺寸的

Sense.DEF: a speech given by the Queen at the official opening of the British Parliament each year, usually in October. The speech is actually written by the government, and it gives details of the government’s plans for the next year, including the new laws it intends to make.
Sense.TRAN: 女王演说〔英国女王在每年议会开幕仪式上的致辞〕

Sense.DEF: an offensive word used to describe someone who is homosexual, especially a man. Do not use this word.
strange or difficult to explain
Sense.EXAMPLE: She gave a queer laugh.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她古怪地笑了笑。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Hank was beginning to feel a little queer.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 汉克开始感觉有点不对头。

Sense.DEF: slightly crazy
Sense.TRAN: 脑子有问题的﹔精神不太正常的

Sense.DEF: an offensive word for a homosexual person, especially a man. Do not use this word.

Sense.LEXUNIT: queer sb's pitch/queer the pitch for sb
Sense.DEF: to make it difficult for someone to do something that they had planned to do
physical violence against people because they are homosexual
Sense.TRAN: 对同性恋者的无故殴打[暴力攻击]

Sense.DEF: to end a situation in which people are behaving violently or protesting, especially by using force
Sense.TRAN: 制止﹔平息﹔镇压〔暴乱局面〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Police used live ammunition to quell the disturbances.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 警方使用真枪实弹平息骚乱。

Sense.DEF: to reduce or stop unpleasant feelings such as fear, doubt, or worry
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Jerry?’ she called, trying to quell the panic inside her.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “杰里？”她叫道﹐试图减轻内心的惊慌。

Sense.DEF: to stop yourself feeling thirsty, by drinking something
Sense.EXAMPLE: We stopped at a small bar to quench our thirst.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们在一家小酒吧停下来喝点东西解渴。

Sense.DEF: to stop a fire from burning
Sense.EXAMPLE: a desperate bid to quench the raging flames
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 为扑灭熊熊大火而不顾一切的努力

Sense.DEF: someone who is querulous complains about things in an annoying way
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘But why can’t I go?’ he said in a querulous voice.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “可是为什么我不能去呢？”他抱怨道。

Sense.DEF: a question that you ask to get information, or to check that something is true or correct

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Give us a ring if you have any queries about the contract.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 如对合同有任何疑问﹐请给我们打电话。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Staff are always available to answer your queries.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 员工随时为您解答疑问。

Sense.DEF: to express doubt about whether something is true or correct
Sense.EXAMPLE: Both players queried the umpire’s decision.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 两名球员都质疑裁判员的判罚。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Many people are querying whether the tests are accurate.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 很多人都对测试的准确性表示怀疑。

Sense.DEF: to ask a question
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘What time are we leaving?’ Maggie queried.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “我们什么时候出发？”玛吉问道。

Sense.DEF: a long search for something that is difficult to find

GramExa.EXAMPLE: his long quest for truth
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他对真理的长期探索
GramExa.EXAMPLE: the quest for human happiness
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 对人类幸福的追求
GramExa.EXAMPLE: World leaders are now united in their quest for peace.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 世界各国领导人现在一致寻求实现和平。

Sense.DEF: trying to find or get something
Sense.EXAMPLE: They journeyed to the distant Molucca islands in quest of spices.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们远赴摩鹿加群岛寻找香料。

Sense.DEF: a sentence or phrase that is used to ask for information or to test someone’s knowledge
Sense.EXAMPLE: Can I ask you a question?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我能问你个问题吗？
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m afraid I can’t answer that question.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我恐怕无法回答那个问题。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: They asked me quite a lot of difficult questions about my job.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们就我的工作问了很多刁钻的问题。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The survey included questions on age and smoking habits.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 调查中包含关于年龄和吸烟习惯的问题。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: In answer to your last question, ‘Yes’.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 对于你最后一个问题﹐我的回答是“是的”。

Sense.DEF: a subject or problem that needs to be discussed or dealt with

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We discussed the question of confidentiality.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们讨论了保密性的问题。

Sense.EXAMPLE: This raises the question of government funding.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这就引出了关于政府资金的问题。
Sense.EXAMPLE: an urgent need to address the question of crime
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 解决犯罪问题的迫切需要
Sense.EXAMPLE: Several questions have still not been resolved.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有几个问题仍然没有得到解决。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The question isshould I take the job in Japan, or should I stay here?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 问题是﹐我应该接受在日本的那份工作﹐还是应该留在这儿？
Sense.EXAMPLE: Some important questions remain unanswered still have not been dealt with or explained.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一些重要问题依然没有解决。

Sense.DEF: if there is some question about something, there is doubt about it, or people feel uncertain about it
Sense.EXAMPLE: The exact cause of death is still open to question not certain.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 确切的死亡原因依然没有确定。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: This has called into question people’s right to retire at 60.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这就对人们在60岁退休的权利提出了质疑。

Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s by far the best candidate, there’s no question about it it is completely certain.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他是到目前为止最合适的人选﹐这是毫无疑问的。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: There is no question that it is completely certain that the government knew about the deal.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 毫无疑问﹐政府是知道这笔交易的。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Her efficiency and intelligence are beyond question.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的效率和智慧是不容怀疑的。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: There are questions about the system’s practicality.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 对于系统的可行性尚有疑问。

Subsense.DEF: used to emphasize that what you are saying is true or correct
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Marilyn was, without question, a very beautiful woman.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 玛丽莲毫无疑问是个大美人。

Subsense.DEF: if you accept or obey something without question, you do it without expressing any doubt about whether it is correct or necessary
Subsense.TRAN: 毫无异议地〔接受或服从〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Clara accepted his decision without question.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 克拉拉毫无异议地接受了他的决定。

Sense.LEXUNIT: there is no question of sth happening/sb doing sth
Sense.DEF: used to say that there is no possibility of something happening
Sense.TRAN: 某事是不可能发生的/某人是不可能做某事的
Sense.EXAMPLE: There is no question of the project being postponed.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个项目不可能推迟。

Subsense.DEF: the things, people etc in question are the ones that are being discussed
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Where were you during the evening in question?
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 所说的那天晚上你在哪儿？

Subsense.DEF: if something is in question, there is doubt about it
Subsense.EXAMPLE: I’m afraid his honesty is now in question.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 恐怕他的诚信现在令人怀疑了。

Sense.DEF: used to say what the most important fact, part, or feature of something is
Sense.TRAN: 问题在于﹐是一个…的问题
Sense.EXAMPLE: Dance is a question of control and creative expression.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 舞蹈就是一个控制形体和创造性表达的问题。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I would love to come, but it’s a question of time.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我倒是想来﹐但问题是要看有没有时间。

Sense.LEXUNIT: it’s just/only/simply a question of doing sth
Sense.DEF: used to say that what needs doing is easy or not complicated
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s just a question of putting in a couple of screws.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 只要拧上几颗螺丝钉就行了。

Sense.DEF: if something is out of the question, it is definitely not possible or not allowed
Sense.EXAMPLE: You can’t go in that old shirt – it’s out of the question.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你不能穿着那件旧衬衫去——这绝对不行。

Sense.DEF: used to admit that you do not know the answer to a question
Sense.TRAN: 好一个难题！问得好！〔用以表示不知道某问题的答案〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘How can we afford this?’ ‘Good question!’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “我们如何能负担得起这个呢？”“问得好！”

Sense.DEF: to ask someone to marry you – used humorously

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Don’t be afraid to ask questions.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 别害怕提问。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: want to ask a question
Collocate.EXAMPLE: I just have one question: is the treatment effective?
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我只有一个问题：这疗法有效吗？

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: ask a question
Collocate.EXAMPLE: He poses the question, ‘What should we teach our children?’
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他提出了一个问题:“我们该教孩子什么？”

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: ask a question in a formal situation
Collocate.EXAMPLE: I recently put some of these questions to a psychologist.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 最近我向一位心理学家请教了这其中的一些问题。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: You haven’t answered my question.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 你还没有回答我的问题。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: not give a direct answer
ask it in a different way
Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: 用另一种方式提出问题

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: ask someone a lot of questions
Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: 向某人连珠炮似的提问

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Some of the questions in the last section were very difficult.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 最后一部分有些问题很难。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: These questions should be easy for you.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些问题对你来说应该很容易。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: interesting or difficult to answer
Collocate.EXAMPLE: That’s a good question.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 问得好。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: one whose answer is obvious
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Did you win, or is that a stupid question?
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 你赢了吗？这问题是不是很蠢？

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: one that someone does not want to answer
Collocate.EXAMPLE: How can we keep the press from asking awkward questions?
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们如何才能不让媒体问尴尬的问题？

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: one that is difficult to answer
Collocate.EXAMPLE: That’s a really tricky question.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 那是个很难回答的问题。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: a question relating to someone’s private life
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Can I ask you a personal question?
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我能问你一个私人问题吗？

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: one that is easy to answer
one that asks for information in a very direct way
a question you ask without expecting an answer, in order to make a point

Exponent.DEF: something that you ask someone, either when speaking or when writing
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Would anyone like to ask any questions?
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 有没有人提问？
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I’ve emailed the hotel with one or two questions.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我已写电子邮件向那家酒店咨询了一两个问题。

Exponent.DEF: a question that you ask when you are not sure you have understood something or that the information you have is correct
Exponent.EXAMPLE: If you have any queries, please contact your travel agent.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 如有疑问﹐请联系旅行社。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Our staff are always available to answer customers’ queries.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们的员工随时可以回答客户的问询。

Exponent.DEF: a question you ask in order to get information or find out the details about something
Exponent.EXAMPLE: We’ve advertised the house, and we’ve already received lots of enquiries.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们给房子登了广告﹐已经有很多人来咨询。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The police have been making some inquiries in the area.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 警方一直在那个地区调查。

Exponent.DEF: a polite or formal question asking for something that you want or need
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The bank said ‘no’ to our request for more money.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 银行拒绝了我们继续贷款的请求。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: You must make your request in writing.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 必须以书面形式提出请求。

Sense.DEF: to ask someone questions in order to get information about something such as a crime
Sense.EXAMPLE: Two men have been arrested and questioned.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 已有两名男子被捕并受到盘问。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She hates being questioned about her past.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她讨厌被人问起她的过去。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Joseph questioned the doctors closely asked them a lot of questions.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 约瑟夫问了医生很多问题。

Sense.DEF: to have or express doubts about whether something is true, good, necessary etc

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Are you questioning what I’m saying?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你是在怀疑我说的话吗？

Sense.EXAMPLE: No one dared to question his decisions.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 没人敢质疑他的决定。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: One questions whether he’s telling the truth.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你会怀疑他是不是在讲真话。

Sense.DEF: not likely to be true or correct
Sense.EXAMPLE: The statistics are highly questionable.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个统计数据大有问题。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It is questionable whether the taxpayer receives value for money.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 纳税人的钱是否用得物有所值是个问题。

Sense.DEF: not likely to be good, honest, or useful
Sense.TRAN: 值得怀疑的﹐可能不诚实的﹐靠不住的
Sense.EXAMPLE: I suspected that his motives for helping us were questionable.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我怀疑他帮助我们是别有用心的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was a man of questionable character.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他这个人的品行值得怀疑。

Sense.DEF: someone who is asking a question, for example in a public discussion
a questioning look or expression shows that you have doubts about something or need some information
Sense.EXAMPLE: Mrs Carson gave Ruth a questioning look.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 卡森夫人怀疑地看了露丝一眼。

Sense.DEF: the mark (?) that is used at the end of a question

Sense.LEXUNIT: there is a question mark over sth/a question mark hangs over sth
Sense.DEF: used to say that there is a possibility that something will not be successful or will not continue to exist
Sense.TRAN: 某事还是个大问号﹐某事尚不确定
Sense.EXAMPLE: A big question mark hangs over the company’s future.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 公司的将来如何还是个大问号。

Sense.DEF: the person who asks the questions in a quiz game on television or radio
a written set of questions which you give to a large number of people in order to collect information
Sense.TRAN: 〔用以收集资料的〕问卷﹐调查表

GramExa.GLOSS: answer all the questions in it
GramExa.EXAMPLE: All staff were asked to fill in a questionnaire about their jobs.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 所有员工都被要求填写一张有关他们工作情况的调查表。

Sense.DEF: a phrase such as ‘isn’t it?’, ‘won’t it?’, or ‘does she?’ that you add to the end of a statement to make it a question or to check that someone agrees with you, as in the sentence: ‘You’re from Hamburg, aren’t you?’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 附加疑问句﹐反意疑问句

Sense.DEF: a line of people waiting to enter a building, buy something etc, or a line of vehicles waiting to move
Sense.TRAN: 〔人或车辆为等候而排的〕队﹐行列

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We stood in a queue for half an hour.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们排了半个小时的队。

Sense.EXAMPLE: You’ll have to join the queue.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你得排队。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a queue of people waiting for the bus
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一队等公共汽车的人

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the queue for the toilets
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 排队上厕所的人

GramExa.EXAMPLE: There was a long queue to get into the cinema.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 人们排长队进入电影院。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: At last we got to the front of the queue.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们终于排到了队伍的前面。

Sense.DEF: all the people who are waiting to have or get something
Sense.EXAMPLE: You’ll have to join the housing queue.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你得排队等待住房分配。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the queue for kidney transplant operations
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 排队等待做肾脏移植手术的患者

Sense.EXAMPLE: It is possible to jump the queue get something before people who have been waiting longer if you are prepared to pay for your treatment.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你要是愿意自费看病﹐可以不用排队。

Sense.DEF: a list of jobs that a computer has to do in a particular order
Sense.TRAN: 队列〔计算机必须按一定顺序处理的一系列工作〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: the print queue
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 打印队列

Sense.DEF: a number of telephone calls to a particular number that are waiting to be answered
to form or join a line of people or vehicles waiting to do something or go somewhere

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Some of the people queuing for tickets had been there since dawn.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 购票队伍中有些人天刚亮就来了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We had to queue up for ages to get served.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 得排很长时间队才会有人给我们上菜。

Sense.DEF: if people are queueing up to do something, they all want to do it very much

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The school is one of the best, and parents are queueing up to send their children there.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这是最好的学校之一﹐父母都争先恐后地送子女到那里上学。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Actresses are queuing up for the part.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 女演员都在竞相争取这个角色。

Sense.DEF: when someone unfairly gets something before other people who have been waiting longer
to argue about small unimportant details
Sense.TRAN: 〔为小事〕争论﹐发牢骚﹔斤斤计较﹔吹毛求疵

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Let’s not quibble over minor details.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们不要为了些细枝末节斤斤计较吧。

Sense.DEF: a small complaint or criticism about something unimportant
Sense.TRAN: 小小的不满[批评]﹔吹毛求疵
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ve just got a few minor quibbles.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我有几个小小的意见。

Sense.DEF: a pie without a top, filled with a mixture of eggs, cheese, vegetables etc

PIC.HEADING: QUICHE 什锦烘饼
PIC.PICCONTENT: quiche 什锦烘饼；pie 馅饼

Sense.DEF: lasting for or taking only a short time
Sense.EXAMPLE: That was quick! I thought you’d be another hour.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 很快啊！我以为你还要一个小时呢。
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s probably quicker by train.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 乘火车可能会快一点。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Have we got time for a quick drink?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们有时间喝口东西吗？
Sense.EXAMPLE: What’s the quickest way to the station?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 到车站怎么走最快？
Sense.EXAMPLE: We stopped to have a quick look at the church.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们停下来迅速地扫了一眼教堂。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Three bombs went off in quick succession quickly, one after the other.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 瞬间有三个炸弹连续爆炸。

Sense.DEF: moving or doing something fast
Sense.EXAMPLE: She walked with short, quick steps.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她迈着小碎步疾行。
Sense.EXAMPLE: They were great people to work with – very quick, very efficient.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们是很好的工作伙伴——迅速﹐高效。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Boxers have to be quick on their feet able to move about quickly.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 拳击手步法必须迅速。

Sense.DEF: happening very soon, without any delay
Sense.EXAMPLE: I had to make a quick decision.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我必须立即作出决定。
Sense.EXAMPLE: We’ve put the house on the market and we’re hoping for a quick sale.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们已经把房子挂牌出售﹐希望很快能卖出去。
Sense.EXAMPLE: We need a quick response from the government.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们需要政府立即作出反应。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Robertson’s quick thinking had saved the little girl’s life.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 罗伯逊的急智救了小女孩的命。

Sense.DEF: able to learn and understand things fast
Sense.TRAN: 聪明的﹐敏锐的﹐脑子反应快的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Jane’s very witty and very quick.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 简非常机智﹐反应敏捷。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She’s a quick learner.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她学东西很快。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s a good interviewer, tough and quick on the uptake able to understand quickly what someone is saying.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他是一名优秀的采访记者﹐风格硬朗﹐领悟力强。

Sense.DEF: used to tell someone to hurry
Sense.EXAMPLE: If you want to come with me you’ll have to be quick – I’m leaving in ten minutes.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果你想和我一块去﹐就得赶紧点——我十分钟后就走。
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Can I just finish this first?’ ‘OK, but be quick about it.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “我能先完成这个吗？”“好的﹐但要快一点。

Sense.DEF: to react quickly to what someone says or does
Sense.EXAMPLE: The government was quick to deny any involvement in the attacks.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府立刻否认参与了袭击事件。

Sense.DEF: a solution to a problem that can be done quickly, but is not a good or permanent solution
Sense.TRAN: 〔很不完善的〕应急解决办法﹔权宜之计
Sense.EXAMPLE: There’s no quick fix for stopping pollution.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 制止污染并没有什么权宜之计。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Congress is trying to avoid quick-fix solutions.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 国会尽力避免采用权宜的解决办法。

Sense.DEF: to get angry very easily

Subsense.DEF: to be able to pull a gun out quickly in order to shoot
to be good at reacting quickly and intelligently to difficult questions or in difficult situations

Sense.DEF: used to tell someone to hurry or come quickly
Sense.EXAMPLE: Quick! We’ll miss the bus!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 快点！我们要赶不上公共汽车了！

Sense.DEF: quickly – many teachers think this is not correct English
Sense.TRAN: 迅速地﹐快速地〔许多教师认为这种说法不正确〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Come quick! Larry’s on TV!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 快来！ 拉里上电视了！
Sense.EXAMPLE: It all happened pretty quick.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 事情发生得非常快。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Quick as a flash very quickly she replied, ‘That’s not what I’ve heard!’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她随即答道:“我听到的不是那样！”

Sense.DEF: the sensitive flesh under your fingernails and toenails
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her nails were bitten to the quick.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的指甲都咬到肉里了。

Sense.DEF: if a remark or criticism cuts you to the quick, it makes you feel extremely upset
Sense.TRAN: 〔言语或批评〕刺痛某人﹐深深伤害某人
Sense.EXAMPLE: She was cut to the quick by the accusation.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这样的指控使她深受伤害。

Sense.DEF: all people, including those who are alive and those who are dead
to become quicker or make something quicker
Sense.EXAMPLE: Ray glanced at his watch and quickened his pace began to walk faster.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 雷瞥了一眼手表﹐加快了步伐。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Companies are finding it hard to cope with the quickening pace of technological change.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 各家公司都发现科技的日新月异让他们难以应付。

GramExa.GLOSS: your heart beats faster because you are afraid, excited etc
GramExa.EXAMPLE: She caught sight of Rob and felt her heart quicken.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她看到了罗布﹐感觉自己心跳加快。

Sense.DEF: if a feeling quickens, or if something quickens it, it becomes stronger or more active
Sense.EXAMPLE: This policy served only to quicken anti-government feeling.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这项政策只会加剧人们的反政府情绪。

Sense.DEF: the first movements of a baby that has not been born yet
done very quickly, one after the other
Sense.TRAN: 连珠炮似的﹐一个接一个的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Contestants have to answer a series of quickfire questions.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 参赛者必须快速回答一连串问题。

Sense.DEF: something that you can do quickly and easily
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ve got a question for you – it’s just a quickie.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我有个问题要问你——很简单的问题。

Sense.DEF: a sexual act that you do quickly – used humorously
Sense.TRAN: 匆匆完事的性交〔幽默用法〕

Sense.DEF: a white powder that is made by heating limestone
fast
Sense.EXAMPLE: We need to get this finished as quickly as possible.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们必须尽快完成此事。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Kids grow up so quickly these days.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 现在的孩子长得真快啊。

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: In everyday English, people usually use a verb such as rush, run or hurry rather than say go quickly.
F2NBox.TRAN: 在日常英语中﹐人们一般使用rush, run／hurry等动词﹐不说go quickly
F2NBox.BADEXA: She went quickly to fetch the doctor.
F2NBox.GOODEXA: She ran to fetch the doctor.

Sense.DEF: after only a very short time
Sense.EXAMPLE: I realized fairly quickly that this wasn’t going to be easy.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我马上就意识到这事没那么容易。

Sense.DEF: for a short time
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ll just quickly nip into that shop.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我就去那家商店很快看一下。
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Have you talked to Vera about it yet?’ ‘Just quickly.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “你跟薇拉谈过此事吗？”“只是简短地谈了谈。”

Exponent.DEF: at a high speed or without taking much time
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The stream was flowing quite quickly.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 小溪水流很急。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: They quickly became friends.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们很快成了朋友。

Exponent.DEF: at a high speed – used especially when talking about how something moves
Exponent.TRAN: 高速地〔尤用于谈论某物的移动速度〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: You're driving too fast!
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 你开得太快了！
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He ran home as fast as he could.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他尽可能快地跑回家。

Exponent.DEF: quickly – used in exclamations or in comparatives
Exponent.TRAN: 快点〔用于感叹句或比较级〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Quick! There’s a mouse!
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 快点！有只老鼠！

Exponent.DEF: quickly
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The government acted swiftly.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府迅速行动。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: She was surprised that he agreed so swiftly.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她很惊讶﹐他那么快就答应了。

Exponent.DEF: quickly – used especially about changes, increases, improvements etc
Exponent.TRAN: 迅速地〔尤指变化﹑增长﹑进展等〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The population is growing rapidly.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 人口在迅速增长。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a rapidly changing world
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 日新月异的世界

Exponent.DEF: quickly and therefore efficiently
Exponent.EXAMPLE: All problems were speedily dealt with.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 所有问题都迅速得到解决。

Exponent.DEF: quickly and energetically
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He walked briskly back along the path.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他沿着小路轻快地走回来。

Exponent.DEF: at a very fast speed – used especially in technical descriptions
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The molecules are travelling at great speed.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 分子在高速运动。

Exponent.DEF: quickly – used about changes, increases, improvements etc
Exponent.TRAN: 快速地〔指变化﹑增长﹑进步等〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Internet shopping is growing at a rapid rate.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 网购正在迅速发展。

Exponent.EXP: as quick as a flash/in a flash
Exponent.DEF: extremely quickly
Exponent.EXAMPLE: As quick as a flash, I was back in my bed and under the covers.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 一眨眼我就回到自己的床上﹐钻进了被窝。

Exponent.DEF: moving extremely quickly
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Like lightning, the cat darted under the bushes.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 那只猫嗖地钻进了灌木丛里。

Exponent.DEF: at the fastest speed possible
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The car was going flat out.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 那辆车在以最高速度行驶。

Sense.DEF: wet sand that is dangerous because you sink down into it if you try to walk on it
a bad situation that keeps getting worse, and that you cannot escape from
Sense.TRAN: 不断恶化且难以摆脱的困境﹔危险局面

Sense.DEF: the metal mercury
something that is like quicksilver changes or moves quickly in a way that you do not expect
Sense.TRAN: 变化莫测的事物﹔神出鬼没的事物
Sense.EXAMPLE: His mood changed like quicksilver.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的情绪变化无常。

Sense.DEF: a dance with fast movements of the feet, or music for this dance
someone who is quick-tempered becomes angry very easily
able to think and understand things quickly
Sense.EXAMPLE: Toby was quick-witted and entertaining.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 托比机智风趣。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a quick-witted reply
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 机敏的回答

Sense.DEF: one pound in money
Sense.EXAMPLE: She earns at least 600 quid a week.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她每周至少挣600英镑。

Sense.DEF: to make a good profit
Sense.EXAMPLE: If this deal comes off, we’ll be quids in.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果这笔交易成功﹐我们会大赚一笔。

Sense.DEF: something that you give or do in exchange for something else, especially when this arrangement is not official

GramExa.EXAMPLE: There’s a quid pro quo for everything in politics – you’ll soon learn that.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 政治里什么都可以等价交换——你很快会明白这一点的。

Sense.DEF: not developing or doing anything, especially when this is only a temporary state
Sense.TRAN: 静止的﹐不活动的﹔休眠的

Sense.DEF: not making much noise, or making no noise at all
Sense.EXAMPLE: We’ll have to be quiet so as not to wake the baby.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们得安静点﹐免得吵醒宝宝。
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s a nice car. The engine’s really quiet.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这车真好﹐发动机声音很小。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ll be as quiet as a mouse very quiet.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我会像老鼠一样悄无声息的。

Subsense.DEF: not saying much or not saying anything
Subsense.TRAN: 寡言的﹔不作声的﹐沉默的
Subsense.EXAMPLE: You’re very quiet, Mom – is anything the matter?
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你一言不发的﹐妈——出什么事了吗？
Subsense.EXAMPLE: I didn’t know anything about it so I just kept quiet.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我对此一无所知﹐所以就保持沉默。

GramExa.GLOSS: having a particular feeling but not talking about it
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 不露声色的自信/暗自满足/无言的绝望
GramExa.EXAMPLE: a woman whose life of quiet desperation threatens to overwhelm her
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个即将被生活中无言的绝望压垮的女人

GramExa.GLOSS: not saying much but making other people have a particular feeling about you
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Jack’s air of quiet authority
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 杰克不言自威的气度

Subsense.DEF: someone who is quiet does not usually talk very much
Subsense.TRAN: 话不多的﹐沉默寡言的﹔文静的

Sense.DEF: used to tell someone to stop talking or making a noise
Sense.EXAMPLE: Tanya, be quiet! I’m on the phone.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 塔尼娅﹐安静！我在打电话呢。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Quiet, you lot!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 安静﹐你们这帮家伙！

Sense.LEXUNIT: keep sth quiet/keep quiet about sth
Sense.DEF: to keep information secret
Sense.EXAMPLE: You’re getting married? You kept that quiet!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你要结婚了？你竟然保密啊！

Sense.DEF: a place that is quiet has no noise or not much noise
Sense.EXAMPLE: Our hotel room was comfortable and quiet.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们的酒店客房舒适安静。
Sense.EXAMPLE: When they walked into the pub, the place went quiet.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们走进小酒店时﹐店内安静下来。

Sense.DEF: without much activity or without many people
Sense.EXAMPLE: It was a Sunday, about three o’clock, and the streets were quiet.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那是一个星期天﹐三点钟左右﹐街上一片寂静。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’d love to go on holiday somewhere where it’s nice and quiet.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我很想到一个美丽又清静的地方去度假。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Anthony met her in the bar, and they found a quiet corner where they could talk.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 安东尼和她在酒吧碰了头﹐他们找了个安静的角落说话。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m going to have a quiet night in an evening when you stay at home and relax.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 晚上我要在家里清静清静。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He wants a quiet life, while she wants to go out partying.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他想过安静平淡的生活﹐而她却想出去玩乐。

Sense.DEF: if business is quiet, there are not many customers
Sense.EXAMPLE: August is a quiet time of year for the retail trade.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 八月份是零售业的淡季。

Sense.DEF: to stop someone from talking, complaining, or causing trouble
Sense.EXAMPLE: Give the kids some crayons – that will keep them quiet for a while.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 给孩子们一些蜡笔——那会让他们安静一会儿。

Sense.DEF: to talk to someone privately when you want to criticize them or tell them about something serious
Sense.EXAMPLE: Brian’s just not keeping up with the workload. Can you have a quiet word?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 布赖恩真的应付不了那些工作﹐你能和他私下谈谈吗？
Sense.HINTTRAN: Do not confuse quiet and quite fairly. 不要混淆quiet(安静)和quite(较为)。

Section.SECHEADING: A QUIET SOUND OR VOICE 轻轻的声音或嗓音

Exponent.DEF: not making a loud sound
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I heard a quiet voice behind me.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我听到身后有人轻声说话。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a car with a quiet engine
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 引擎噪音低的汽车

Exponent.DEF: quiet – especially because you do not want people to hear or be disturbed
Exponent.TRAN: 〔尤因不想让别人听见或受到妨碍〕低声的
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Doug was on the phone, speaking in a low voice.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 道格在打电话﹐声音压得很低。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I turned the volume down low.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我把音量调低。

Exponent.DEF: quiet and pleasant to listen to
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Soft music was playing in the background.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 播放着轻柔的背景音乐。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: His voice was soft and gentle.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的声音轻柔温和。

Exponent.DEF: not making any sound at all
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a silent prayer
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 默祷
Exponent.EXAMPLE: silent laughter
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 无声的笑
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The machines were virtually silent.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些机器几乎没有声音。

Exponent.DEF: deliberately quiet because you do not want people to hear – used about people’s voices
Exponent.EXAMPLE: They were talking about money in hushed tones.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们正压低声音谈论钱的问题。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The doctor’s voice was hushed and urgent.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 医生的声音又低又急。

Exponent.DEF: quiet and difficult to hear because it comes from a long way away
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The men went ahead and their voices got fainter and fainter.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 人们往前走去﹐他们的声音越来越小。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: the faint sound of bells
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 依稀可闻的钟声

Exponent.DEF: difficult to hear, for example because the sound comes from another room or someone’s mouth is covered by something
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Muffled voices were coming from downstairs.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 楼下传来模模糊糊的说话声。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: the muffled sound of someone crying
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 隐约有人在哭的声音

Exponent.DEF: too quiet to hear
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The sound is inaudible to the human ear.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这种声音人耳无法听见。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Her answer came in an almost inaudible whisper.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的回答声音弱得几乎听不见。

Section.SECHEADING: A QUIET PLACE 安静的地方

Exponent.DEF: without much noise
Exponent.EXAMPLE: It’s so quiet here at night.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这儿晚上可真安静。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: This is the quietest room in the house to work in.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 在这所房子里﹐就是这间屋子工作最安静。

Exponent.DEF: with no noise at all
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The room fell silent became silent.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 房间里安静下来。

Exponent.DEF: quiet in a pleasant and relaxing way
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Life’s more peaceful in the countryside.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 乡村生活更平静。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The hotel is set in tranquil surroundings.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 酒店周围很安静。

Exponent.DEF: quiet – used about a town or village where there are not many people and very little happens
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a sleepy fishing village
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 寂静的渔村

Section.SECHEADING: NOT SAYING MUCH 话不多的

Exponent.DEF: not saying much
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He’s a quiet boy who loves reading.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他是个文静的男孩﹐喜欢看书。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: You’re very quiet tonight, Suzy – are you OK?
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 你今晚都没怎么说话﹐苏齐——没事吧？

Exponent.DEF: not saying anything
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Her husband was a big silent man.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她丈夫很高大﹐沉默寡言。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Everyone was arguing but I decided to remain silent.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 大家都在争﹐但我决定保持沉默。

Exponent.DEF: not talking much and seeming a little unfriendly or bad-tempered
Exponent.TRAN: 沉默寡言的﹐不苟言笑的
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He found Vaughn a taciturn and rather difficult person.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他觉得沃恩这个人不苟言笑﹐很难相处。

Exponent.DEF: unwilling to talk to other people, especially about a particular subject
Exponent.TRAN: 〔尤指对某个话题〕不愿多谈的
Exponent.EXAMPLE: She’s always been reticent about her early life.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她向来不愿多谈自己以前的生活。

Exponent.DEF: someone who does not talk much, especially because they only speak when there is something important to say
Exponent.EXAMPLE: My father was a man of few words, but when he spoke everyone listened.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我父亲是个沉默寡言的人﹐不过他一开口﹐大家都会听。

Sense.DEF: the state of being quiet, calm, and peaceful
Sense.EXAMPLE: We were enjoying the quiet of the forest.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们享受着森林的静谧。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ve had an awful day – now I just want some peace and quiet.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我今天过得糟透了——现在只想清静清静。

Sense.DEF: silence
Sense.EXAMPLE: Can I have some quiet, please?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 让我安静一会儿﹐好吗？

Sense.DEF: secretly
Sense.EXAMPLE: We found out he’d been doing some freelance work on the quiet.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们发现他一直在接私活。

Sense.DEF: to become calmer and less noisy or active, or to make someone or something do this
Sense.EXAMPLE: Javed Miandad appealed for calm, but he failed to quieten the protesters.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 贾维德•米安达德呼吁大家冷静﹐但他未能让抗议者安静下来。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Quiet down and get ready for bed!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 别闹了﹐准备睡觉！
Sense.EXAMPLE: Things tend to quieten down after Christmas.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 圣诞节过后﹐一切都会平静下来。

Sense.DEF: to reduce a feeling such as fear or worry
Sense.EXAMPLE: I managed to quieten her fears.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我设法减轻了她的恐惧。

Sense.DEF: when you accept situations and do not try to change them
Sense.TRAN: 淡泊﹔清静无为﹔消极接受

Sense.DEF: without making much noise
Sense.EXAMPLE: Rosa shut the door quietly.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 罗莎悄悄关上门。
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘I’m sorry,’ she said quietly.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “对不起。”她轻声说道。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a quietly-spoken man one who always speaks quietly
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 说话轻柔的男人

Sense.DEF: in a way that does not attract attention
Sense.EXAMPLE: The mayor had been aiming to quietly turn over control of the city’s water to private business interests.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 市长一直想悄悄地把该市的供水控制权交给私营企业。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The government hoped that their early mishandling of the crisis could be quietly forgotten.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府希望他们早前处理危机的失误能无声无息地被人淡忘。

Sense.DEF: without protesting, complaining, or fighting
Sense.TRAN: 安静地〔指不抗议﹑不抱怨﹑不吵架〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Now are you gonna come quietly, or do I have to use force?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你是乖乖地过来﹐还是非要我动武才行？
Sense.EXAMPLE: Speculation is growing that Grogan will be replaced at the end of the season, and he is unlikely to go quietly.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 越来越多的人猜测格罗根将在本赛季结束时被替换掉﹐而他是不会善罢甘休的。

Sense.DEF: fairly confident of success, but without talking proudly about it
Sense.EXAMPLE: Adam came out of the interview feeling quietly confident.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 亚当面试后出来﹐心中很有把握。

Sense.DEF: calmness, peace, and quiet
the death of a person
the end of something
a part of a man’s hair style where the hair stands up at the front above his forehead
a pen made from a large bird’s feather, used in the past
a stiff bird’s feather
one of the long pointed things that grow on the back of a porcupine
a warm thick cover for a bed, made by sewing two layers of cloth together, with feathers or a thick material in between them
quilted cloth consists of layers held together by lines of stitches that cross each other
Sense.EXAMPLE: a quilted bath robe
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有衬里的浴袍

Sense.DEF: the work of making a quilt, or the material and stitches that you use
Sense.TRAN: 被子绗缝﹔被料及缝制针法

Sense.DEF: a quintuplet
a hard yellow fruit like a large apple, used in cooking
a drug used for treating fevers, especially malaria
a quintuplet
a perfect example of something
Sense.EXAMPLE: John is the quintessence of good manners.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 约翰彬彬有礼﹐堪称典范。

Sense.DEF: being a perfect example of a particular type of person or thing
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Guys and Dolls’ is the quintessential American musical.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 《少男少女》是典型的美国音乐剧。

RunOn.EXAMPLE: a place that is quintessentially English
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 具有典型英国特色的地方

Sense.DEF: five singers or musicians who perform together
Sense.TRAN: 五重唱组合﹔五重奏乐团

Sense.DEF: a piece of music written for five performers
one of five babies born to the same mother at the same time
to say something clever and amusing
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Giving up smoking is easy,’ he quipped. ‘I’ve done it hundreds of times.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “戒烟很容易啊﹐”他风趣地说﹐“我已经戒过几百次了。”

Sense.DEF: 24 sheets of paper
something strange that happens by chance

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Years later, by a strange quirk of fate, she found herself sitting next to him on a plane.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 许多年以后﹐真是机缘巧合﹐她在飞机上发现自己就坐在他旁边。

Sense.DEF: a strange habit or feature of someone’s character, or a strange feature of something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Like every computer, this one has its little quirks.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 就像所有电脑一样﹐这台也有它的小毛病。

Sense.DEF: unusual, especially in an interesting way
Sense.EXAMPLE: I like his quirky sense of humour.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我喜欢他那种奇特的幽默感。

Sense.DEF: someone who helps an enemy country that has taken control of their own country
to leave a job, school etc, especially without finishing it completely
Sense.TRAN: 离开〔工作岗位﹑学校等〕﹔离任﹔辍学
Sense.EXAMPLE: He quit his job after an argument with a colleague.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他和一个同事争吵后就辞职了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I quit school at 16.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我十六岁辍学。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She has decided to quit show business.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她已决定退出娱乐圈。
Sense.EXAMPLE: People are now calling on the chairman to quit.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 人们现在正要求主席辞职。

Sense.DEF: to stop doing something, especially something that is bad or annoying
Sense.TRAN: 停止做〔尤指坏事或令人厌烦的事〕﹐戒除
Sense.EXAMPLE: The majority of smokers say that they would like to quit the habit.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大多数吸烟者都说他们是想戒烟的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Quit it, Robby, or I’ll tell mom!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 住手﹐罗比﹐否则我告诉妈妈！
Sense.EXAMPLE: We’ve done what we can. Let’s quit.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们已经尽力﹐算了吧。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He’s been given six months to live if he doesn’t quit drinking.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他如果不戒酒﹐就只能活六个月。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: I wish you’d all quit complaining.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我希望你们都不要再抱怨了。

Sense.DEF: to leave a house or apartment that you have been renting
Sense.EXAMPLE: The landlord gave them notice to quit the premises within seven days.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 房东通知他们七天之内搬出去。

Sense.DEF: to no longer have to suffer or be involved with something bad
Sense.EXAMPLE: The people now long to be quit of war.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 人们现在渴望结束战争。

Sense.DEF: to leave a place
Sense.EXAMPLE: It was ten years since he had quit Russia.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他离开俄罗斯已经有十年了。

Sense.DEF: very, but not extremely
Sense.EXAMPLE: The food in the cafeteria is usually quite good.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 食堂的饭菜通常很不错。
Sense.EXAMPLE: His hair is quite thin on top now.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他头顶的头发现在很稀疏了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Amy’s at college, and she’s doing quite well.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 埃米在上大学﹐成绩很不错。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He’s quite a good soccer player.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他是个相当不错的足球运动员。

F2NBox.HEADING: GRAMMAR 语法
F2NBox.EXPL: Put quite before ‘a’ and an adjective and noun, not after ‘a’.
F2NBox.TRAN: quite放在a加形容词加名词之前﹐不放在a之后
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: It took quite a long time (NOT不说a quite long time).

Sense.DEF: fairly, or to a small extent, but not very
Sense.EXAMPLE: The film was quite good, but the book was much better.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 电影还不错﹐但书更好看。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I got a letter from Sylvia quite recently.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不久前我收到了西尔维娅的一封信。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I quite like Chinese food.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我还挺喜欢中国菜的。

Sense.DEF: a fairly large number or amount
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s got quite a lot of friends.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的朋友很多。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Quite a few towns are now banning cars from their shopping centres.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 现在有不少城镇禁止汽车驶入购物中心。

Sense.DEF: completely
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m sorry. That’s quite impossible.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我很抱歉﹐那是完全不可能的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: What she’s suggesting is quite ridiculous!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的建议太荒谬了！
Sense.EXAMPLE: I think you’ve had quite enough to drink already!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我想你喝得已经够多了！
Sense.EXAMPLE: That’s quite a different matter.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那完全是另一回事。

Sense.DEF: not completely
Sense.EXAMPLE: They weren’t quite ready so we waited in the car.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们没有完全准备好﹐所以我们在车里等着。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m not quite sure where she lives.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不太确定她住在哪儿。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Dinner’s almost ready, but not quite.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 晚饭差不多好了﹐但还没有完全准备妥当。

Sense.DEF: not exactly why, what, where etc
Sense.TRAN: 不完全是因为/是…那样/是某地等
Sense.EXAMPLE: The play wasn’t quite what we expected.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 该剧不像我们想的那么好。

Sense.DEF: used before a noun to emphasize that something is very good, large, interesting etc
Sense.TRAN: 不寻常的﹔出众的﹔相当不错的〔用于名词前作强调〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: That was quite a party you had.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你的聚会搞得非常不错。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The engines make quite a noise.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 引擎的声音很大。
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s quite some distance away.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那儿相当远。

Sense.DEF: a fairly long time
Sense.EXAMPLE: We’ve been waiting for quite some time now.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们已经等了相当长的时间。

Sense.DEF: used to show that you agree strongly with someone
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘I refuse to do any more work.’ ‘Quite right. They can’t expect you to work for nothing.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “我拒绝再做任何事情了。”“说得对。他们不能让你无偿工作。”

Sense.DEF: used to reply to someone that you are not angry about something they have done
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘I’m sorry we’re so late.’ ‘That’s quite all right.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “很抱歉我们来得太晚了。”“没有关系。”

Sense.DEF: used to show that you agree with what someone is saying
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘They really should have thought of this before.’ ‘Yes, quite.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “他们之前确实就该想到这一点。”“正是。”

Sense.DEF: used to say that someone or something is very impressive
Sense.TRAN: 令人难忘的人[事]﹔不寻常的人[事]

GramExa.EXAMPLE: to walk out on stage in front of 20,000 people.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 上台面对两万名观众这很了不起。

Sense.DEF: if two people are quits, neither one owes anything to the other
Sense.TRAN: 扯平﹐两相抵消﹐互不相欠
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ll give you £10, and then we’re quits.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我给你10英镑﹐我们就互不相欠了。

Subsense.DEF: to agree that a debt or argument is settled
Subsense.TRAN: 彼此两清﹔(同意)结束争论
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Just give me $20 and we’ll call it quits.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 给我20美元﹐我们就两清了。

Subsense.EXAMPLE: After 25 years as a teacher, he’s decided to call it quits.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在当了25年老师之后﹐他决定不干了。

Sense.DEF: someone who does not have the determination or courage to finish something that is difficult
Sense.TRAN: 遇到困难就放弃的人﹐半途而废的人

Sense.DEF: to shake slightly because you are cold, or because you feel very afraid, angry, excited etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: The child was quivering in her arms.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那孩子在她怀里发抖。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her mouth quivered slightly as she turned away.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她嘴唇微微哆嗦着﹐转过头去。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I lay there quivering with fear.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我躺在那儿﹐害怕得直发抖。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: His voice was quivering with rage.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他气得声音都打战了。

Sense.DEF: a slight trembling

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I felt a quiver of excitement run through me.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我激动得全身一阵颤抖。

Sense.DEF: a long case for carrying arrows
quixotic ideas or plans are not practical and are based on unreasonable hopes of improving the world
Sense.TRAN: 堂吉诃德式的﹐愚侠(式)的﹔不切实际的﹐空想的
Sense.EXAMPLE: This is a vast, exciting, and perhaps quixotic project.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这是一个庞大﹑令人兴奋的项目﹐但可能有点不切实际。

Sense.DEF: a competition or game in which people have to answer questions
Sense.EXAMPLE: a love quiz in a magazine
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 杂志上的爱情问答
Sense.EXAMPLE: a general knowledge quiz
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 常识问答竞赛

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I get fed up with television quiz shows.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我十分厌烦电视上的智力游戏节目。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a quiz night held in the local pub
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 当地酒吧举办的智力竞赛晚会

Sense.DEF: a short test that a teacher gives to a class
Sense.EXAMPLE: a biology quiz
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 生物测验

Sense.DEF: to ask someone a lot of questions

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Four men have been quizzed about the murder, but no one has yet been charged.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 四名男子就这桩谋杀案接受了盘问﹐但目前尚无人被起诉。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: They quizzed me on my involvement in the scheme.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们盘问我是否参与了这个计划。

Sense.DEF: someone who asks people questions during a quiz
a quizzical expression is one that shows that you do not understand something and perhaps think it is slightly amusing

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He sat and watched her, a quizzical look on his face.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他坐下来看着她﹐一脸疑惑。

Sense.DEF: a game in which you throw rings over a small upright post
the ring that you throw in this game
a small circle made of large vertical stones in ancient times
a long metal building with a curved roof where soldiers live or things are stored
Sense.TRAN: 匡西特活动房屋〔供士兵居住或存放物品〕

Sense.DEF: a vegetable substance you can use in cooking instead of meat
the smallest number of people who must be present at a meeting so that official decisions can be made
Sense.TRAN: 〔会议中使决定有效的〕法定人数
Sense.EXAMPLE: We need a quorum of seven.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们需要有七人的法定人数。

Sense.DEF: an official limit on the number or amount of something that is allowed in a particular period

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The government has imposed quotas on the export of timber.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府已对木材出口实行配额制。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The government has decided to scrap quotas on car imports.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府决定取消汽车进口配额。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Several countries have now set quotas for cod fishing.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 现在已有几个国家对鳕鱼捕捞设定了限额。

Sense.EXAMPLE: There are plans to introduce strict immigration quotas.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有计划要推行严格的移民限额制度。

Sense.DEF: an amount of something that someone is expected to do or achieve

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Each person was given a quota of tickets to sell.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 每个人都被分派了售票的指标。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: In the 1990s the Navy couldn’t fill its quota for new recruits.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 20世纪90年代海军无法完成征兵指标。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Workers only get paid if they make their quota.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 工人只有完成定额才有工资。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: They’re worried that they won’t achieve this year’s sales quota.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们担心完不成今年的销售指标。

Sense.DEF: an amount of something that you think is fair, right, or normal
Sense.TRAN: 〔公正的﹑正确的或正常的〕份额

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The committee has had more than its quota of problems.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 委员会遇到了特别多的问题。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: I think I’ve had my quota of coffee for the day.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我想我今天喝的咖啡已经够多了。

Sense.DEF: a particular number of votes that someone needs to get to be elected in an election
Sense.TRAN: 〔候选人当选所需的〕规定票数﹐最低票数

Sense.DEF: a quotable remark or statement is interesting, clever, or amusing
Sense.EXAMPLE: a speech full of witty, quotable phrases
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 妙语连珠的演讲

Sense.DEF: a sentence or phrase from a book, speech etc which you repeat in a speech or piece of writing because it is interesting or amusing

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a quotation from the Bible
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 引自《圣经》的话

Sense.EXAMPLE: The following quotation is taken from a nineteenth century travel diary.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 下文引自19世纪的一篇旅行日记。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a dictionary of quotations
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 引语词典﹐语录汇编

Sense.DEF: a written statement of exactly how much money something will cost

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Ask the builder to give you a written quotation for the job.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 叫建筑商给你一份这项工作的书面报价。

Sense.EXAMPLE: a quotation for car insurance
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 汽车保险的报价单

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a couple of quotations from different companies before you decide which one to use.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 先从不同的公司拿到一些报价﹐然后再决定用哪一家。

Sense.DEF: the act of quoting something that someone else has written or said
one of a pair of marks (‘’) or (“ ”) that are used in writing to show that you are recording what someone has said
to repeat exactly what someone else has said or written

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She quoted from a newspaper article.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她引用了报纸上一篇文章的内容。

Sense.EXAMPLE: He quoted a short passage from the Bible.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他引用了《圣经》里的一小段。
Sense.EXAMPLE: A military spokesman was quoted as saying that the border area is now safe.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 报道引述军方一位发言人的话﹐说边境地区现在很安全。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Can I quote you on that?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 那是你说的﹐我能照实说吗？

Sense.DEF: to give a piece of information that is written down somewhere
Sense.EXAMPLE: You can order by phoning our hotline and quoting your credit card number.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 可拨打我们的热线电话订购﹐并报出你的信用卡号码。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He quoted a figure of 220 deaths each year from accidents in the home.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他援引了一个数字——每年有220人在家中意外死亡。

Sense.DEF: to give something as an example to support what you are saying
Sense.EXAMPLE: Mr Jackson quoted the case of an elderly man who had been evicted from his home.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 杰克逊先生举了一个老人被赶出家门的例子。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He quoted the example of France as a country with good rail service.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他举了法国为例﹐说法国是铁路服务很完善的一个国家。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The nurses’ union was quoted as an example of a responsible trade union.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 护士协会被认为是负责任的工会组织的典范。

Sense.DEF: to tell a customer the price you will charge them for a service or product
Sense.EXAMPLE: They quoted a price of £15,000.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们报价1.5万英镑。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The firm originally quoted £6,000 for the whole job.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 公司最初给这整项工作报价6,000英镑。

Sense.DEF: to give the price of a share or currency
Sense.EXAMPLE: The pound was quoted this morning at just under $1.46.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 今天早上英镑的牌价不到1.46美元。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The company is now quoted on the stock exchange people can buy and sell shares in it.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这家公司现在已经在证券交易所挂牌上市了。

Sense.DEF: used when you are going to repeat what someone else has said, to emphasize that it is exactly the way they said it
Sense.TRAN: 这是某人的原话〔作插入语〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The minister said, quote: ‘There will be no more tax increases this year.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 部长说﹐这是他的原话:“今年不会再加税了。

Sense.DEF: used at the beginning and end of a word or phrase that someone else has said or written, to emphasize that you are repeating it exactly
Sense.TRAN: 〔用于引文的开始和结尾〕原话起…原话止

Sense.DEF: a sentence or phrase from a book, speech etc which you repeat in a speech or piece of writing because it is interesting or amusing

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a quote from the minister’s speech
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 引自部长演讲的一句话

Sense.DEF: words that are in quotes are written with quotation marks around them to show that someone said those words
a statement of how much it will probably cost to build or repair something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Always get a quote before proceeding with repair work.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 找人修理一定要先叫他们报价。

Sense.DEF: a way of saying ‘I said’, ‘he said’ etc
ordinary, and happening every day
the amount or degree of a quality, feeling etc in a person, thing, or situation
Sense.EXAMPLE: Is all this healthy food supposed to increase my happiness quotient?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 所有这些健康食品能提高我的幸福指数吗？

Sense.DEF: the number which is obtained when one number is divided by another
the holy book of the Muslims
used to tell readers to look in another place in the same book for a piece of information
a qwerty keyboard on a computer or typewriter has the keys arranged in the usual way for English-speaking countries, with Q, W, E, R, T, and Y on the top row
